title: Kimi K2.5: Visual Agentic Intelligence
description: Simon Willison analyzes Kimi K2.5, examining new developments in visual agentic AI capabilities and their implications for software development workflows. Explores how visual understanding is becoming integrated with agentic AI systems.
author: Simon Willison

title: One Human + One Agent = One Browser From Scratch
description: Case study examining how a single human working with one AI agent successfully built a browser from scratch, demonstrating the potential of human-AI collaboration for complex software projects. Shows that focused human guidance combined with AI agents can achieve remarkable results.
author: Simon Willison

title: FastRender: A Browser Built by Thousands of Agents
description: Analysis of an ambitious project attempting to build a web browser using AI agents, exploring the practical challenges and successes of large-scale autonomous coding efforts. Examines whether thousands of coordinated AI agents can successfully complete complex software projects.
author: Simon Willison (analyzing Wilson Lin's work)

title: Cursor's OpenAI-Powered Agents Built and Ran a Browser
description: Fortune coverage of Cursor using a swarm of AI agents powered by OpenAI to build and run a web browser for an entire week without human assistance, demonstrating significant progress in autonomous agent capabilities. This represents a milestone in long-running autonomous coding.
author: Fortune
